title: What goes on at Riot HQ, probably

replies.body:
The sad part is this might be accurately true...

I mean so many simple solutions found in just a matter of seconds, suggested by the playerbase, agreed by most to all, and riot acts like a wall and does something else and makes it worse.

I've heard when the scuttle change was new, players were rage quitting simply if they lost the scuttle in I think plat elo...even if it was 1...
I remember when they removed the warding smite jungle item "because too many players were taking it as a second sightstone ~~and we don't like lots of vision because that means less danger~~."

> [{quoted}](name=Busty Demoness,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NQUh6GJq,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-04-03T04:43:33.306+0000)
>
> I remember when they removed the warding smite jungle item "because too many players were taking it as a second sightstone ~~and we don't like lots of vision because that means less danger~~."

I'm no balance expert or a jungle main, but this was just stupid...

This feels like one of the balance team is an assassin main or something.
Idk, I kind of feel like that it make counter-jungling a much less effective strategy.

You say that as if it were a bad thing. I think jungling needs to allow for passive, safer strategies to be viable. If you have to constantly be aggressive to stay in the game, then your whole game is ruined if you lose an early duel and/or can't get an early gank.

> [{quoted}](name=Monlyth,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NQUh6GJq,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-04-03T06:30:16.290+0000)
>
> You say that as if it were a bad thing. I think jungling needs to allow for passive, safer strategies to be viable. If you have to constantly be aggressive to stay in the game, then your whole game is ruined if you lose an early duel and/or can't get an early gank.

You really want Yi to be meta if jungling was so safe? It's really not a good idea for jungler's to be allowed to do nothing but farm.
Yi is already in the meta and outclasses a lot of junglers (even aggressive ones like Elise), so that seems like a moot point.

> [{quoted}](name=Monlyth,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NQUh6GJq,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-03T06:39:21.229+0000)
>
> Yi is already in the meta and outclasses a lot of junglers (even aggressive ones like Elise), so that seems like a moot point.

Well, maybe in Silver and below.
Well, according to League of Graphs, in Platinum+, Master Yi has 7.8% popularity, 51% winrate, and a 12.8% banrate. So I'd classify that as being in the meta, and outclassing several other junglers.

> [{quoted}](name=Monlyth,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=NQUh6GJq,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-04-03T12:03:02.925+0000)
>
> Well, according to League of Graphs, in Platinum+, Master Yi has 7.8% popularity, 51% winrate, and a 12.8% banrate. So I'd classify that as being in the meta, and outclassing several other junglers.

Hmm. You appear to be right.

And from your suggestions, you want that to be greatly improved by giving power farmers like him even more farm.

I want junglers to have more options than just ganking at level 3-4. As of right now, you will run out camps to clear and you have to either gank or leech XP from the lanes to avoid falling behind on levels (more than you already are, that is). If there are no good opportunities for you to gank, you're kinda screwed. This is why the likes of Lee Sin and Jarvan are on top of the Jungle meta right now, and why Jungle is such an unpopular role in NA now. Aggressive jungle strats are the only viable strats now, and falling behind on ganks or getting counter-jungled often spells doom for you.

If Yi would become overpowered in a meta where passive, safer strats are a viable option to fall back on when your team is behind, then that's a Yi problem. Or rather, a Conqueror problem, since that seems to be what pushes Yi over the edge.
I swear, the jungle undergoes more frequent and dramatic changes than any other role, from Smite buffs to Scuttle duels to spawn timers.

I like the playstyle of Jungle, but I'd enjoy it more if I didn't feel forced to gank early on after clearing all my camps (even if there are no good opportunities to do so), the Scuttle Crab wasn't such a crucial fixture of your early game, I wasn't behind on XP for most of the game, and my teammates didn't point fingers at me when they feed their lane.

CAreful balance has to be struck so that farming isn't the ideal thing for junglers to do at any time because it makes games static and boring when they do.

Ganking should always be the most valuable thing which is facilitated by farming camps
